alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mineral; Hampshire; Hardy (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued October 17 at 12:53PM EDT until October 18 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures around 26 to 32 degrees, mainly above 1500 feet. * WHERE...In Maryland, Garrett, Extreme Western Allegany and Central and Eastern Allegany Counties. In West Virginia, Hampshire, Hardy and Eastern Mineral Counties. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 10 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
